page.title: 09ALRESFORD HOUSE
page.content: An Eighteenth Century House built by Admiral Lord Rodney in 1752. Now lived in and owned by the family of Wing Commander Gerald Constable Maxwell a distinguished War-time fighter pilot. Family portraits include those of the Jacobite Earl of Nithsdale who escaped the Tower of London in 1716, the night before his execution. There is a private family chapel designed by Pietro Annagoni with work by Rossellini. Today the house is open to the Public for picnics, teas and 12 acres of fruit for 'pick your own'.The facilities are available for receptions, conferences and so on. Local staff are employed at the house.
